questions.question: Danish astronomer Ole Roemer was the first person to measure the speed of light. What is that value?
questions.hint: 238,900 miles is the linear distance of the earth to the moon

questions.question: Apollo 8, 10-17 flew to the moon between 1969-1972. How many people have stepped foot on the moon?
questions.hint: Apollo 13 never landed

questions.question: Who was the first commander of the Space Shuttle? This person also flew to the moon - twice.
questions.hint: John Glenn went back to space in the 90s

questions.question: Chemist Otto Han discovered this process, which can release enormous amounts of energy, in 1938.
questions.hint: This can make cheap energy or a big boom.

questions.question: The Large Hadron Collider at CERN discovered this fundamental partical in 2012; though it had been theorized back in 1964.
questions.hint: This particle is classified as a boson.

questions.question: This landmark evidence of the Big Bang Theory was discovered by accident in 1965 by Arno Penzias and Robert Wilson:
questions.hint: It is part of the electromagnetic spectrum.

questions.question: What is the largest Country by land area in South America?
questions.hint: This country has Portugese as its national language

questions.question: Marseille is a former colony of this ancient empire:
questions.hint: This empire was incorporated into a larger and more robust neighbor.

questions.question: What is the longest river in Europe?
questions.hint: This river flows into the Caspian Sea.

questions.question: The five themes of Geography are: Location, Human-Environment Interaction, Movement, Region, and...
questions.hint: This theme is similar to one already listed.

questions.question: The Fertile Crescent is a region believed to be one of the first locations of agricultural settlement. It is near modern day:
questions.hint: This area is between two rivers

questions.question: This area of Northern Europe used to be a land bridge. It reached its maximum extent 8000bc.
questions.hint: It dissapeared after the last ice age.

questions.question: This mid-century computer used a 15-bit wordlength and had a core rope memory (RAM) storage of 4KB
questions.hint: It fit inside a small space.

questions.question: Due to their speed and distance from Earth, GPS Satellites must compensate for this Einsteinian theory:
questions.hint: It's a concept explored in the movie Interstellar.

questions.question: This Austrian-born actress was also a self-taught inventor who discovered and patented Frequency Hopping.
questions.hint: Her discovery aided the Allies during WWII.

questions.question: Steve Jobs visited this company and 'borrowed' their Graphical User Interface for Apple products:
questions.hint: 'We both had this rich neighbor.. I broke in to steal the TV and found that you had already stolen it.' - Bill Gates

questions.question: A cathode-ray tube (CRT), a type of [???] was used by Philo Farnsworth to create the first electronic television.
questions.hint: Such devices were also used in early computers to implement logic.

questions.question: This microprocessor had a clock rate of 1-3 MHz and powered the Apple II, NES, and Commodore 64.
questions.hint: It wasn't made by Intel.

questions.question: The Bayeux Tapestry depicts this famous medieval battle which altered the course of English history.
questions.hint: This event was related to the Norman Conquest.

questions.question: This period of widespead societal collapse occured during the 12th century BC in the Mediterranean.
questions.hint: It coincided with the downfall of Mycenaean Greece.

questions.question: This secret diplomatic communication pushed the United States into WWI.
questions.hint: It proposed a military contract between Germany and Mexico.

questions.question: This thirteen days of tension in October 1962 almost brought the world into nuclear war.
questions.hint: An island in the Caribbean became the focal point of this incident.

questions.question: This earthen structure just outside of St. Louis was once the largest pre-Columbian settlement in North America.
questions.hint: It was the larest and most infleuntial urban settlement of the Mississippian Culture.

questions.question: On this date, the Japanese Empire carried out a surprise attack on an American outpost in the Pacific.
questions.hint: It brought the US into WWII.
